A. Welcome to Psychological Practice Template Documentation!

Thank you for purchase Psychological Practice HTML5 Template!

I hope this template will be helpful for you - if you'll have any problems using it, please contact me via this support email. Feel free to send me your website URL, which has been created using this template - I'll be happy viewing it!

B. Template installation

This template has been written in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript (with jQuery). After downloading this template from your user panel on ThemeForest, you have to unzipped all files to some local folder on your computer.

All of the template files are placed in "psychological-practice" directory. Select all template files and open your FTP Client (for example FileZilla). Then, make connection with your server (you may need your server name, FTP username and password).

Locate the domain folder, where you want to install this template and then open "public_html" (or similar) directory. After that, make an upload of all files to selected folder - that's all!

C. HTML structure

In "psychological-practice" directory you can find 9 template files, configured as same as demo page (but without demo images):

  • index.html
    this is home page of this template

  • about-me.html
    this is page configured for psychologist "about" page

  • contact.html
    this is contact page with Google Map

  • blog.html,
    blog-single.html
    this are blog pages - for blog posts list and for single blog post

  • therapies.html
    this is page for therapies list

  • therapy.html
    this is page for single therapy description

  • price-list.html
    this is page for pricing list

  • 404-page.html
    this is page for 404 error (page not found)

C.3. Sections

In Psychological Practice template you can use 10 different sections, to show your website content in the best way. You can use this sections in any order, and you can use the same section on the same page more than once.

C.3.1 Sections: Heading slider

This is main slider for home page. You can use here buttons and / or links for different actions, and two versions of heading title:





    
    


        
        

        
        

        


        
        


            
            


                
                
Psychological care
 at the highest level


                
                


                    
                    Check our offer 

                    
                    
                    or find out more about us

                


            


        


    


    
    


        
        

        
        

        


        
        


            
            


                
                
Full discretion
 and the highest standards

C.4. Sections modificators

You can use two section modificator classes, to fit is to your own needs:

  • Section with gray background, instead of white
  • Section without padding on top

    If you want to remove padding on top side of the section, add "without-top-space" class to your section element.

You can combine this section modificators - here is simple example for "double-content" section:

C.5. Other elements

You can use a lot of predefined HTML elements in your new website:

C.5.1 Forms

General construction of any form is as follow:





    

    
    

    
    


        
        

        


        
        


            
            


                
                


                    

                


                Sending...

            


            
            


                
                


                    

                


                Your message has been sent, thank you!

                
                Close this notice

            


            
            


                
                


                    

                


                Please try again.

                
                Close this notice

If you want your form to be placed in "box", use "form-box" class in form element:

For any form element you can use any form fields, in any order. But, you need to use minimum two fields - for client name and for client email. This fields should be a text fields.

Text fields code is as follow:

Code for "select" fields is as follow:

For all fields you can also use "textarea" field:

You can use custom "checkbox" fields, using this code:






    
    

    
    
I agree with Terms and Conditions and I've read and agree Privacy Policy.

If you want to use datepicker for your text field, add "is-datepicker" class to your field and add "readonly" attribute:

D. CSS structure

Stylesheet file is located in "_assets/_css" directory. For all .html files you need to include only one .css file - "style.css". This template has been written using CSS3 - if you haven't used it before, go to this w3schools.com website - it's very helpful introduction.

Open "style.css" file (this is main stylesheet for Psychological Practice HTML5 template) to see the CSS structure.

E. JavaScript

Psychological Practice HTML5 template needs only one javascript file, located into "_assets/_js/" directory - functions.js; This is main javascript file with general functions and settings.

You shouldn't make any configuration changes in "functions.js" file - any customizations, like Google Map marker position should be done in HTML file.
